tool.name: pcdl_plot_timeseries
tool.command: #import re mkdir output_pc && #for $file in $path: #set $filename = re.sub('[^\w\-\.\s]', '_', str($file.element_identifier)) ln -s $file output_pc/$filename && #end for pcdl_plot_timeseries output_pc '$focus_cat' '$focus_num' '$aggregate_num' --custom_data_type $custom_data_type --microenv $microenv --physiboss $physiboss --settingxml '$settingxml' --verbose $verbose --frame $frame --z_slice '$z_slice' --logy $logy --ylim '$ylim' --secondary_y $secondary_y --subplots $subplots --sharex $sharex --sharey $sharey --linestyle $linestyle --linewidth '$linewidth' --cmap '$cmap' --color '$color' --grid $grid --legend $legend --yunit '$yunit' --title '$title' --figsizepx $figsizepx --ext $ext --figbgcolor '$figbgcolor'

param.name: path
param.label: path
param.help: path to the PhysiCell output data collection

param.name: focus_cat
param.label: focus_cat
param.help: categorical or boolean data column within dataframe specified under frame (pcdl_get_cell_attribute_list or pcdl_get_substrate_list). default is None, which is total, which is all agents or voxels, no categories. default is None.

param.name: focus_num
param.label: focus_num
param.help: numerical data column within dataframe specified under frame (pcdl_get_cell_attribute_list or pcdl_get_substrate_list). default is None, which is count, agent or voxel count. default is None.

param.name: aggregate_num
param.label: aggregate_num
param.help: aggregation function {max, mean, median, min, std, var} for focus_num data. default is mean.

param.name: custom_data_type
param.label: custom_data_type
param.help: parameter to specify custom_data variable types other than float (namely: int, bool, str) like this var:dtype myint:int mybool:bool mystr:str. downstream float and int will be handled as numeric, bool as Boolean, and str as categorical data. default is an empty string.

param.name: microenv
param.label: microenv
param.help: should the microenvironment be extracted and loaded into the df_cell dataframe? setting microenv to False will use less memory and speed up processing, similar to the original pyMCDS_cells.py script. default is True.

param.name: physiboss
param.label: physiboss
param.help: if found, should physiboss state data be extracted and loaded into the df_cell dataframe? default is True.

param.name: settingxml
param.label: settingxml
param.help: the settings.xml that is loaded, from which the cell type ID label mapping, is extracted, if this information is not found in the output xml file. set to None or False if the xml file is missing! default is PhysiCell_settings.xml.

param.name: verbose
param.label: verbose
param.help: setting verbose to True for more text output, while processing. default is False.

param.name: frame
param.label: frame
param.help: to specifies the data dataframe from which the values are taken. cell: agent centric value. conc: whole domain centric substarte concentration values. default is cell.

param.name: z_slice
param.label: z_slice
param.help: z-axis position to slice a 2D xy-plain out of the 3D mesh. if z_slice position numeric but not an exact mesh center coordinate, then z_slice will be adjusted to the nearest mesh center value, the smaller one, if set to None, the whole domain is taken. default is None.

param.name: logy
param.label: logy
param.help: if True, then y axis is natural log scaled. default is False.

param.name: ylim
param.label: ylim
param.help: two floats separated by a space. y axis min and max value. None detects automatically detects min and max value. default is None.

param.name: secondary_y
param.label: secondary_y
param.help: whether to plot on the secondary y-axis. if a listing of string, which columns to plot on the secondary y-axis. default is False.

param.name: subplots
param.label: subplots
param.help: whether to split the plot into subplots, one per column. default is False.

param.name: sharex
param.label: sharex
param.help: in case subplots is True, share x-axis by setting some x-axis labels to invisible. default is False.

param.name: sharey
param.label: sharey
param.help: in case subplots is True, share y-axis range and possibly setting some y-axis labels to invisible. default is False.

param.name: linestyle
param.label: linestyle
param.help: matplotlib line style {-, --, .-, :} string. default is - .

param.name: linewidth
param.label: linewidth
param.help: line width in points, integer. default is None.

param.name: cmap
param.label: cmap
param.help: matplotlib colormap string from https://matplotlib.org/stable/tutorials/colors/colormaps.html . default is None.

param.name: color
param.label: color
param.help: listing of color strings referred to by name, RGB or RGBA code. default is None.

param.name: grid
param.label: grid
param.help: plot axis grid lines. default is True.

param.name: legend
param.label: legend
param.help: if True or reverse, place legend on axis subplots. default is True.

param.name: yunit
param.label: yunit
param.help: string to specify y-axis unit. None will not print a unit on the y-axis. default is None.

param.name: title
param.label: title
param.help: title to use for the plot. None will print no title. default is None.

param.name: figsizepx
param.label: figsizepx
param.help: size of the figure in pixels (integer), x y. the given x and y will be rounded to the nearest even number, to be able to generate movies from the images. default is 640 480.

param.name: ext
param.label: ext
param.help: output image format. possible formats are jpeg, png, and tiff. default is jpeg.

param.name: figbgcolor
param.label: figbgcolor
param.help: figure background color. None is transparent (png) or white (jpeg, tiff). default is None.

tool.help:
this function to generate a timeseries plot and either returns a matplotlib figure or an image file (jpeg, png, tiff).
homepage: https://github.com/elmbeech/physicelldataloader
